activity_1_b.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වචන නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_1_d.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_1_e.text:
Read along.
පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න.
ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

content.sentence_text: The t'i'mber in the back of the shed is true and ready for wall framing. ( means not warped or bent)
The sh'i'm plate is a thin plate used to fill small gaps when aligning machinery.
The l'i'ntel  is strong enough to support the doorway above the entrance opening.
The crane is used to l'i'ft huge concrete beams during heavy construction operations.

activity_2.focus: Focus Verb BE, Prepositions of Place, Phrases ‘on the left’ and ‘on the right’

example.text:
Listen to the model dialogue.
ආදර්ශ සංවාදයට සවන් දෙන්න.
மாதிரி உரையாடலை கேளுங்கள்.

activity_2_a.text:
Match the words with the pictures.
පදයන් පින්තූර සමග ගැලපන්න.
சொற்களைப் படங்களுடன் பொருத்துங்கள்.

activity_2_c.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_2_d.text:
Read along.
පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න.
ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

activity_2_e.text:
Listen to each question, use the pause to answer it, then compare your response with the model answer.
සෑම ප්‍රශ්නයකටම සවන් දෙන්න, පිළිතුරු දීමට විරාමය භාවිතා කරන්න, ඉන්පසු ඔබේ පිළිතුර ආදර්ශ පිළිතුර සමඟ සසඳන්න.
ஒவ்வொரு கேள்வியையும் கேட்டு, இடைவெளியைப் பயன்படுத்தி பதிலளியுங்கள். பின்னர் உங்கள் பதிலை மாதிரி பதிலுடன் ஒப்பிடுங்கள்.

example_dialogues.text_b: It is on the left, under the maroon mats.
They are on the right, behind the beige shelves.

example_dialogues.text_a: Where is the water levelling hose?
example_dialogues.text_b: It is on the right, above the lime green buckets.

keywords.word: Reflective safety vests / navy blue boxes
site fire bucket / dark red signs

dialogues.text_a: Where are the reflective safety vests?
dialogues.text_b: They are on the right, beside the navy blue boxes.
They are on the left, in between the silver trays.

dialogues.text_a: Where is the building layout plan?
dialogues.text_b: It is on the left, above the brown rags.
They are on the right, next to the black stands.

dialogues.text_a: Where is the site fire bucket?
dialogues.text_b: It is on the left, in front of the dark red signs.

dialogues.text_a: Where is the construction notice sticker?
dialogues.text_b: It is on the right, above the turquoise labels.

activity_a.text:
You will hear each recording twice. Listen and choose the correct answer.
ඔබට සෑම පටිගත කිරීමක්ම දෙවරක් ඇසෙනු ඇත. සවන් දී, නිවැරදි පිළිතුර තෝරන්න.
ஒவ்வொரு ஒலிப்பதிவையும் நீங்கள் இருமுறை கேட்கலாம். கேட்டு சரியான பதிலைத் தேர்ந்தெடுக்கவும்.

activity_b.text:
Listen.
සවන් දෙන්න.
கேளுங்கள்.

activity_c.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_d.text: Read along. පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න. ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

examples.sentence: What’s the required depth of this well? (Deep / Depth / Shallow)

content.sentence: What’s the required width of this access platform? (Width / Wide / Narrow)
What’s the required height of this storage roof? (Height / High / Low)
What’s the required length of this ceiling frame? (Length / Long / Short)
What’s the required thickness of this protective steel sheet? (Thickness / Thick / Thin)
What’s the required capacity of this fuel reservoir? (Capacity / Full / Low)
What’s the required pressure in this distribution pipeline? (Pressure / High / Low)
What’s the required voltage for this electrical supply line? (Voltage / High / Low)
What’s the required temperature in this curing chamber? (Temperature / Hot / Cold)
What’s the required diameter of this ventilation duct? (Diameter / Wide / Narrow)
What’s the required speed of this conveyor drive unit? (Speed / Fast / Slow)

activity_b.text: What’s the required width of this access platform? It is 666 cm. But this access platform is only 575 cm wide at the moment. This access platform is 91 cm too narrow for safe movement.
What’s the required height of this storage roof? It is 4,200 mm. But this storage roof is only 3,950 mm high. This storage roof is 250 mm too low for the required clearance.
What’s the required length of this ceiling frame? It is 37 m. But this ceiling frame is only 34 m long in the current layout. This ceiling frame is 3 m too short for this warehouse.

What’s the required thickness of this protective steel sheet? It is 18 mm. But this protective steel sheet is only 14 mm thick on inspection. This protective steel sheet is 4 mm too thin for reinforcement.
What’s the required capacity of this fuel reservoir? It is 8,500 litres. But this fuel reservoir was only 7,900 litres full this morning. This fuel reservoir was 600 litres too low for operation.
What’s the required pressure in this distribution pipeline? It is 310 bar. But this distribution pipeline is only at 276 bar right now. This distribution pipeline is 34 bar too low for normal flow.

What’s the required voltage for this electrical supply line? It is 415 volts. But this electrical supply line is only at 384 volts under load. This electrical supply line is 31 volts too low for equipment start-up.
What’s the required temperature in this curing chamber? It is 920°C. But this curing chamber is only at 870°C on the display. This curing chamber is 50°C too cold for correct treatment.
What’s the required diameter of this ventilation duct? It is 980 mm. But this ventilation duct is only 900 mm wide in the new section. This ventilation duct is 80 mm too narrow for proper airflow.
What’s the required speed of this conveyor drive unit? It is 1440 rpm. But this conveyor drive unit is only at 1320 rpm when operating. This conveyor drive unit is 120 rpm too slow for production.

activity_c.text: What’s the required depth of this deep bore well?
What’s the required width of this access platform?
What’s the required length of this storage roof?
What’s the required thickness of this protective steel sheet?
What’s the required capacity of this fuel reservoir?
What’s the required diameter of this ventilation duct?
This well is forty-three metres too shallow to reach the water bed.
This ceiling frame is three metres too short for this warehouse.
This fuel reservoir is six hundred litres too low for operational use.
This ventilation duct is eighty millimetres too narrow for proper airflow.

activity_d.text: What’s the required depth of this deep bore well?
What’s the required width of this access platform?
What’s the required length of this storage roof?
What’s the required thickness of this protective steel sheet?
What’s the required capacity of this fuel reservoir?
What’s the required diameter of this ventilation duct?
This well is forty-three metres too shallow to reach the water bed.
This ceiling frame is three metres too short for this warehouse.
This fuel reservoir is six hundred litres too low for operational use.
This ventilation duct is eighty millimetres too narrow for proper airflow.

activity_a.text:
Listen to the audio which will be played twice and click on the correct answer. It is very important that you read the questions before you listen to the recording.
ඔබට සෑම පටිගත කිරීමක්ම දෙවරක් ඇසෙනු ඇත. නිවැරදි පිළිතුර ක්ලික් කරන්න. රෙකෝඩින් එක අහන්නට පෙර ප්‍රශ්නය කියවීම ඉතාමත් වැදගත්ය.
ஒவ்வொரு ஒலிப்பதிவையும் நீங்கள் இருமுறை கேட்கலாம். கேட்ட எண்களை குறித்து எழுதுங்கள். பதிவைக் கேட்பதற்கு முன் கேள்விகளைப் படிப்பது மிகவும் முக்கியம்.

activity_b.text:
Listen.
கேளுங்கள்.
සවන් දෙන්න.

activity_c.text:
Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී වාක්‍ය නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.

activity_d.text: Read along. පිටපත සමඟ කියවන්න. ஒரே நேரத்தில் வாசியுங்கள்.

Questions.question: What kind of building did the trainees work on yesterday?
options: A two storey- masonry and machinery factory

Questions.question: What problem did Saman mention at the beginning of the work?
Questions.answer: The spirit level was not straight.
options: The spirit level was not straight.

Questions.question: What problem did Tharindu mention at the beginning of the work?
Why did the instructor say accuracy is critical in foundation work?
Questions.answer: Because wrong alignment weakens the whole structure.
options: Because wrong alignment weakens the whole structure.
Because wrong alignment makes the whole structure wobble.

Questions.question: What are the trainees going to do next week?
Questions.answer: Start the block work for the ground floor walls
options: Start the casting work for the ground floor walls
Repair the foundation on the ground level
Start the block work for the ground floor walls

activity_b.text: Yesterday was a very busy day on site.
We worked on the foundation for the new training workshop near the back gate.
It’s not a small job at all.
It’s a two-storey building for masonry and plumbing classes.
The concrete work was heavy, but the base looks solid now.
So, how did you feel doing your first big foundation job?
Honestly, I didn’t think it would be so hard.
The ground is quite rocky in some places, so the excavation took longer than we expected.
At the start, the spirit level wasn’t 100% straight, and that caused a problem.
The footing width was fine later in the day, but in the morning there was a problem with accuracy.
The concrete mixer was very noisy the whole day.
I checked the formwork, tied the reinforcement bars, and cleaned the shuttering panels.
Some boards were damaged, so we couldn’t use them which was very annoying.
A few measurements were wrong at the beginning, and that was quite stressful.
Yes, accuracy really matters in foundation work.
If the alignment is off, the whole structure becomes weak.
The concrete mix was good, but one section was a bit uneven.
That wasn’t ideal, but we figured out how to adjust it.
The levels are correct now, and the columns are clearly marked.
I agree.
Once the concrete started to set, the site felt tense.
The site supervisor was strict, and everyone stayed alert.
We all knew that here was no room for mistakes.
After the final checks, everything looked fine.
The foundation is level, and the edges are clean.
It’s not perfect everywhere, but it meets the standard laid out in the blueprint which is the most important thing.
By the end of the day, we were tired but satisfied.
It was such a relief to see our hard work paying off!
Today it’s much quieter.
There’s no casting work.
We’re just checking drawings and tools.
Next week, you’re going to start the block work for the ground floor walls.
Sounds good.
Next time, we’re going to be better prepared.
Now we have a fairly good understanding of the site conditions and the correct order of work.

activity_c.text: It’s not a small job at all.
It’s a two-storey building for masonry and plumbing classes.
The ground is quite rocky in some places, so the excavation took longer than we expected.
The footing width was fine later in the day, but in the morning there was a problem with accuracy.
Some boards were damaged, so we couldn’t use them which was very annoying.
A few measurements were wrong at the beginning, and that was quite stressful.
If the alignment is off, the whole structure becomes weak.
That wasn’t ideal, but we figured out how to adjust it.
We all knew that here was no room for mistakes.
It’s not perfect everywhere, but it meets the standard laid out in the blueprint which is the most important thing.
There’s no casting work.
Sounds good.

activity_d.text: It’s not a small job at all.
It’s a two-storey building for masonry and plumbing classes.
The ground is quite rocky in some places, so the excavation took longer than we expected.
The footing width was fine later in the day, but in the morning there was a problem with accuracy.

instrction_a.text:
Watch this video to help you better understand today’s lesson.
අද පාඩම හොඳින් අවබෝධ කර ගැනීමට මෙම වීඩියෝව බලන්න.
இன்றைய பாடத்தை நன்றாக புரிந்துகொள்ள இந்த வீடியோவைப் பாருங்கள்.

instruction_b.text:
These steps will help you to learn English from this video.
මෙම පියවරන් ඔබට මෙම වීඩියෝවෙන් ඉංග්‍රීසි ඉගෙන ගැනීමට උදව් කරනු ඇත.
இந்த வீடியோவிலிருந்து ஆங்கிலம் கற்க இந்த படிகள் உங்களுக்கு உதவும்.
steps:
Watch the video 2 times.
වීඩියෝව වර දෙකක් බලන්න.
வீடியோவை இரண்டு முறைப் பாருங்கள்.

Explain any new words using Google Translator.
Google පරිවර්තකය භාවිතයෙන් නව වචන කිහිපයක් විස්තර කරන්න.
Google மொழிபெயர்ப்பாளரைப் பயன்படுத்தி சில புதிய வார்த்தைகளை விளக்குங்கள்.

Listen and repeat.
සවන් දී නැවත කියන්න.
கேட்டு மீண்டும் சொல்லுங்கள்.
